questions.neutral: Timing's good - not too busy, huh?

hobby.message: Find any ghosts in the tunnels?
Analog photography survive another day in Stenograd?

wrong_hobby_answer: That's not me. In free time, I explore the city's underground. It's a different world down there.
neutral_answer: Yeah, counts for something these days.
Been poking around old tunnels—urban exploring, nothing fancy.
Not as quiet down there lately, with all that’s been going on.
Best keep to habits, all the same.
Quiet's rare since the BCI glitch started mucking up routines.
I do a bit of urban exploration—sealed tunnels, old server rooms.
Found some extra company belowground last week, didn’t linger.
Everyone's got their eye out now—can’t say I blame them.
Best places get crowded fast once the city's in chaos.
Good to see a place that hasn’t changed pace.
I like poking through utility tunnels—urban exploration, nothing illegal.
Usually peaceful, even with the chaos upstairs lately.
Ran into some new faces underground, not regulars like me.
Seems everyone’s hiding from those BCI score swings.
Makes a private hobby a little less private these days.
I could use the calm, honestly—it’s been chaos out there.
Urban exploration's my thing; sealed data centers, disused maintenance shafts, you name it.
Normally, there’s peace and quiet, just me and the circuits.
But lately, since the scores started jumping, more people are sneaking below.
Last week, I ran into two amateurs looking for a hideout.
Feels like the city’s driving folks underground—literally and otherwise.
Not as simple to enjoy solitude when everyone’s watching each other's backs.
This bar’s one of the last constants for me these days.
My hobby’s urban exploration—utility tunnels, old grid nodes, all the forgotten veins of the city.
Spent years mapping spots nobody else cares about, just chasing silence and neglect.
Used to be I’d bring a flask, settle in with a busted conduit, and let the day slip by.
Now, since Halden’s death and the BCI glitches, those tunnels are full of strangers and paranoia.
People are ducking into my haunts trying to disappear from the score swings.
Last Thursday, almost tripped over a pair of would-be dissidents near an old ventilation hub.
Funny thing—places built to hide cables now hide half the city from itself.
hobby_answer: Yeah, back in the tunnels. Nothing special.
Crowds down there now. Makes it less useful.
Everything's noisy with these BCI jumps.
Was quieter before all this mess.
Just keeping to myself lately.
Yeah, did some exploring.
Supposed to be quiet, but too many new faces lately.
Patrols chasing low-score types underground now.
Makes it harder to find a safe spot.
Saw a couple trying to bypass old locks.
People smell trouble. Crowd the dark corners lately.
Yeah, hit a utility tunnel last night. Nothing glamorous.
Used to be empty—now half the city's poking around.
Since the BCI went haywire, everyone’s chasing shadows.
Neighborhood patrols showing up, even in sealed corridors.
Spotted digital graffiti even underground, if you can believe it.
You can feel folks are more desperate lately.
Makes a fellow miss solitude, I’ll tell you.
Yeah, went for a crawl through the old data-centers.
Those tunnels used to be my escape, right?
Now, since the BCI glitch, I run into strangers nightly.
Whole city’s on edge, trust gone, everyone hiding from their own scores.
Had to ditch my last spot—patrol showed up looking for ‘dissidents’.
Saw two kids scraping burnt tags off a firewall panel.
Nobody used to care about access panels. Now, even amateurs risk the current.
Miss the days I could drink in peace, that's all.
Sure, urban exploration’s a habit I picked up fixing State gear.
Started for the quiet, away from everyone and everything but old wiring.
Now, after Halden’s dead and scores are scrambling, it's chaos underground.
Got blocked by a dozen squatters last trip—half running, half hiding, nobody trusting each other.
Factions are sending spotters down now. Even had a Harmonist ask me for a map.
I've stashed tools in three locations—can't keep 'em in one spot anymore.
Patrols act jumpy. Saw 'em tasing a 'rogue' just for sleeping next to a dataline.
Never thought I’d have to defend a hatch code from strangers.
These days, nostalgia’s the only thing that fits in one pocket.
